events.name: Tea Conversations : New York edition
events.description: ​Hi friends!​Welcome to Solei, a social teahouse concept that connects people from different walks of life.​It is your third place, your city’s living room, where we sit down to talk to one another beyond small talk over a shared cup of tea (plus snacks!)​—​What to expect:​Arrival (~15min):You’ll be sat down in a group as you arrive while the host serves you tea.​Conversations (~75min):Chat with the group over tea and a few curated questions in a semi-structured manner (depending on the group size, we’ll either speak as one group or break down into smaller groups). We’ll also come together as a group to get to know who’s in the room.​Free flows (~30min):Grab more tea and have amazing conversations.​—​This is the first, of many, pop-up events to come. Thank you for checking us out early! Your ticket includes tea refills and snacks.​Dress comfortably (you may need to sit on the floor) and bring your lovely self. Try to come on time, if you are running late send a note to the host via Luma!​Looking forward to meeting you,​Coco​​If you’re curious on why we’re doing this and the story behind this initiative, read this blog post:Slow Spaces for Conversation.​Our website:http://dearsolei.com/

events.name: BuildHub #2 - 3D Modelling CAD Workshop
events.description: ​​Have the knack to design your own mechanical products and 3D print them? Unsure where to start? Fear not.​​HI! I'mSuraj Kumarand I can teach you how to become a maker in three days. I was the CTO of Sherpy, a drone startup that manufactured small, long-range airplanes for commercial delivery (sherpymedia.com). I now founded a neurotech startup (Cerelog.com).There are a lot of visionaries and hackers around in New York City, but materializing an idea can be quite the wall to climb! What are the real-world constraints to pay attention to when designing something? Where's the space where you can build things fast and get great advice?!​This is a small-group, high attention workshop, targeting 10-15 creative people who have the itch to create things.Light on theory, heavy on practice!​WHAT YOU'LL DO​Get familiar with Fusion360!​​​Design your own custom spray bottle using Fusion360. Use it for cleaning around your house/pranking your dog!​​​We provide the nozzle and tube—you design the rest!​​​3D print your creation on the high performance Bambu X1 Carbon printer​​​DETAILS​​​Five-day workshop (~3 hrs per session)​Mon, Tue, Wed, Thurs, Fri​​​Professional guidance from an experienced engineer​​​Learn to navigate Fusion360 and think like a designer​​​REGISTRATION​​$250 / person for the 5 days​​​Limited spots available​​​Reserve your seat today!​Your Host:​​​Suraj Kumar, Mechanical Engineer with years of Fusion360 experience​​​*thank you tofractal techfor hosting us!*Contact at surajratnam99@gmail.com

events.name: SideQuest #24
events.description: ​​​Come join us for a chill afternoon dedicated to your sidequests!Whether it's writing, painting, coding that new app, or literally any other “SideQuest” you’ve been putting off, this is your space to create. This isn’t about 'work' in the traditional sense—it's about crafting something meaningful to you, free from pressure.​​We'll have focused work sessions to help you make real progress, all set to the backdrop of some lo-fi, balanced with breaks to reset, unblock each other, and mingle with other creators.​​Rough Agenda​​2:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Introductions and Intention Sharing​​2:30 PM - 3:45 PM: Deep Focus Session 1​​3:45 PM - 4:15 PM: Break​​4:15 PM - 5:30 PM: Deep Focus Session 2​​5:30 PM - 6:00 PM: if you wanna share your work, we’d love to see it! If not, that’s cool, too!​​6:00 PM: Optional hangout afterward :)*please plan on staying for the whole duration to avoid disrupting the quiet work periods​​**thank you tofractal techfor hosting us! and thank you to our friends atPurdueHackers,CozySundaysandSocraticafor seeding the idea!___________________AboutSideQuest:We host coworking sessions biweekly! Subscribe to our events calendar if you can’t make this one :)

events.name: Maximum New York April Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​This event will also feature a brief graduation ceremony for several cohorts ofThe Foundations of New York City!​There will be drinks and snacks!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.

events.name: Sfânt's Spring Revelry
events.description: ​Event​Join us atSfânt's Spring Revelryas we expand to a new, much bigger space for our 5th popup! Soak up the spring sunshine on the rooftop, enjoy a cozy corner with a book on the living room's couches, or find collaborators to aid you on your latest sidequest.​What is Sfânt?​Sfânt is a popup cafe serving modern coffee and tea beverages. All profits are donated to charity. We feature frequent collaborators, such as pastry chefs, ambiance engineers, and tattoo artists.Come learn about coffee and enjoy some, might we say, excellent beverages!See our last popup's recap on ourInstagram.​Menu​Emily, fresh from her stint as a pastry chef at Momoya, has something special baking for this event.​For coffee, we're brewing up something extraordinary for this celebration... it involves some snazzyclarification:O ;)

events.name: The Internet Bookshop: A FarCon Side Event at Fractal
events.description: ​A literary event and pop-up book fair alongside FarCon NYC.​Come by for:​Literary themed beverages and refreshments.​A curation of physical and digital fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and zines by authors and publishers in the Farcaster ecosystem.​A series of readings and author talks (presenters TBD!)​Giveaways of rare print books and onchain limited digital editions.​Fractal NYC writers, please reach out to Amelie (amelie@alexandriabooks.com) if you'd like to showcase your work as part of the event!​Featuring:​Alexandria Labs (alexandriabooks.com), the Library of Alexandria for onchain books​Debbie Soon, author of Digital Mavericks (Wiley) and co-founder ofthehug.xyz(acq. by Art Domains)​Phil Mohun, founder of Bright Moments,amps.fun, and Node Foundation​Well Read (https://wellread.pt/), a bilingual art & design bookstore, event space and meeting place located in Lisbon, Portugal

events.name: Code and Coffee Hackathon
events.description: ​Please sign up here:https://www.meetup.com/new-york-code-coffee/events/306632486/?eventOrigin=group_upcoming_events​Join us for an exciting day of coding, collaboration, and coffee in the heart of New York City. This event is perfect for software engineers, designers, and enthusiasts alike.
